resources.name: Community Action Services And Food Bank - Provo
resources.description: A non-profit organization that provides emergency assistance and long-term support to help families in poverty become self-reliant through programs and counseling.
resources.servicesText:
Help getting an ID; verify homelessness (waives ID fee and residency requiremnts), 
then apply in person at Drivers License Division office)

* Food pantry
* Rent & rent deposit payment assistance (as available)
*Utility service payment assistance (as available)
* Personal finance counseling
* Driver license fee payment (as available)
* Clothing vouchers (as available)
* Bus fare (as available)

resources.name: Deseret Industries (Provo)
resources.description: Thrift store and job training opportunities.
resources.servicesText:
Nonprofit thrift store
Training and job readiness
Further education
Remove employment barriers
Explore career options
Support during job search

resources.name: DWS Vocational Rehabilitation - Provo Office
resources.address: 150 E Center St Suite 3300, Provo, UT 84606
resources.description: Vocational rehabilitation services (disability employment support).
resources.servicesText:
Employment--help with resume, workshops, paying for education or training, apprenticeships
Veteran and Military employment services--education, training, career path, transition
Refugee resettlement, employment, resources
Disabled services, blind, deaf, eligility, vocational rehabilititation

resources.name: Easterseals-Goodwill Senior Employment Program (SCSEP)
resources.description: Paid on-the-job training for qualifying older adults.
resources.servicesText:
Early intervention for disabled children under three
On-the-job employment services for low-income adults over 55.

resources.name: Family Promise Salt Lake
resources.address: 814 W 800 S, Salt Lake City, UT 84104
resources.description: Emergency shelter and support for families with children experiencing homelessness.
resources.servicesText: Provide safe family emergency shelter and basic needs for families with children.

resources.name: Food and Care Coalition
resources.description: Provides services for individuals who are homeless, including prepared hot meals, bathing facilities, haircuts, laundry, dental, case management, emergency shelter, and transitional housing. Also has onsite partners providing mental health and medical services.
resources.servicesText:
Help getting an ID; verify homelessness (waives ID fee and residency requiremnts), 
then apply in person at Drivers License Division office)

* prepared hot meals
* public showers/baths
* laundry facilities
* haircuts / grooming supplies
* dental services (as available)
* case management
* emergency shelter
* transitional housing
* temporary mailing address (as available)

resources.name: Housing Authority of Utah County
resources.description: Affordable housing programs
resources.servicesText: Portal for waiting lists for housing for 55+, 62+, family housing, Spring Lake Apartments and Willow Cove.

resources.name: Mountainlands Community Health Center (Provo Family Health Center)
resources.description: Sliding-fee primary care clinic and related services.
resources.servicesText:
Provide low-income, uninsured and under-insured persons with high-quality health care.
Medical
Mental Health
Dental
Pharmacy

resources.name: Odyssey House of Utah
resources.description: Substance use disorder and mental health treatment programs.
resources.servicesText: Largest and most comprehensive addiction program in Utah. Free for low-income Salt Lake residents.

resources.name: Provo City Housing Authority
resources.description: Public housing and housing assistance for Provo residents.
resources.servicesText:
Help with Dept. of Housing and Urban Development programs: 
Public Housing and Housing Choice Voucher program for the city of Provo

* Supportive Housing
* LIHTC (Low-Income Housing Tax Credit) housing
* Senior housing (six Provo locations)
* Family Self Sufficiency program

resources.name: Proxima Careers
resources.description: Supports pathways into healthcare certification/degree programs and job readiness.
resources.servicesText:
Career assessment
Certification/degree from a school of your choice. They cover the majority or full costs.

resources.name: St. Vincent de Paul Dining Hall & Bishop Weigand Resource Center (CCS Utah)
resources.address: 437 W 200 S, Salt Lake City, UT 84101
resources.description: Meals and basic needs services (Salt Lake City).
resources.servicesText:
* Bishop Weigand Resource Center (shelter)
* St. Vincent de Paul Dining Hall
* St. Vincent's Kitchen Academy (fourteen week culinary arts training)
* Refugee services: foster care for unaccompanied minors, resettlement

resources.name: Tabitha's Way
resources.phone: Pleasant Grove: 801-692-1881, Spanish Fork: 801-709-8573, Saratoga Springs: 801-692-1881, ext 301
resources.address: 675 W Garden Dr #100, Pleasant Grove; 50 E 100. North, Spanish Fork, 1439 N Commerce Dr, Saratoga Springs
resources.description: A non-profit organization that provides a food pantry and hygiene items to those in need in the community.
resources.servicesText:
Requirements: picture ID, proof of address (for example a piece of mail)

* Food pantry--two week supply of food twice a month
* Hygiene items
* Diapers (as available)
* Baby food (as available)
* Thanksgiving baskets (seasonal)

resources.name: The Road Home
resources.address: 242 Paramount Ave, Salt Lake City, UT 84115 (Gail Miller Resource Center)
resources.description: Shelter and housing services (Salt Lake County); statewide referral relevance.
resources.servicesText:
Homeless services line: 801-990-9999
FINCH housing--family emergency shelter with private furnished rooms for families with children
Pamela Atkinson Resource Center (shelter)
Gail Miller Resource Center (shelter)
Connie Crosby Family Resource Center

resources.name: United Way of Utah County
resources.description: A wide range of listings of resources
resources.servicesText: directory of a wide range of resources in Utah County.

resources.name: UTA Paratransit
resources.description: Paratransit scheduling and information line.
resources.servicesText: Transportation for people with physical, cognitive or visual disabilities who are functionally unable to independently use the UTA fixed route bus service.

resources.name: UTA Reduced Fare FAREPAY Card
resources.address: Apply online or at UTA customer service locations
resources.description: Reduced fare program for qualifying riders (seniors, youth, disability, income-qualified).
resources.servicesText: $1.00 one-way fares for qualifying seniors, youth, disabled, low-income

resources.name: Utah Community Action
resources.description: Programs including homelessness prevention and workforce supports.
resources.servicesText:
emergency rental assistance
eviction mediation 
criminal record expungement
utility assistance
home weatherization
nutrition education
Head Start preschool
Workforce Development (Offering classes, certifications, and services at no cost, 
the Workforce Development program assists in obtaining employment, increasing 
wage-earning potential, and improving resume and interviewing skills.)

resources.name: Utah Crisis Line (Huntsman Mental Health Institute)
resources.description: 24/7 crisis support and diversion resources.

resources.name: Utah Department of Workforce Services - Provo Employment Center
resources.description: Job search help, employment counseling, and related workforce services.
resources.servicesText:
Employment--help with resume, workshops, paying for education or training, apprenticeships
Veteran and Military employment services--education, training, career path, transition
Refugee resettlement, employment, resources
Disabled services, blind, deaf, eligility, vocational rehabilititation

resources.name: Utah DHHS Opidemic - Free Naloxone
resources.description: State resource page for free naloxone locations and information.

resources.name: Utah Naloxone
resources.description: Naloxone awareness, training, and access resources.

resources.name: Utah Transit Authority (UTA) - Contact
resources.description: Public transit information and customer service for UTA services.

resources.name: Volunteers of America, Utah
resources.address: 1875 S Redwood Rd., Salt Lake CIty, youth resource center at 888 S 400 W, Salt Lake City
resources.description:
Homeless resources
Drop-in resource center and emergency shelter for youth ages 15–22.
resources.servicesText:
* homeless support: shelters, meals, basic needs, education, employment, 
  legal aid, housing, physical and mental health care
* addiction detox
* Youth Resource Center for ages 15-22 who are homeless or at risk of 
  homelessness; wide range of help: shelter, meals, showers, laundry, dental, medical

resources.name: Wasatch Behavioral Health (Utah County)
resources.description: Community mental health authority for Utah County.
resources.servicesText:
Outpatient mental health
psychological assessment
medical services
crisis residential support (stay for up to a week)
crisis residential service for children and youth 10-17 (runaways, runaway risks, serious parent-child conflicts.)

resources.name: The Boulders
resources.servicesText:
The Boulders Apartments offers one, two and three bedroom apartments 
at an affordable price, with picturesque views of the Utah mountains. 
Enjoy plenty of on-site outdoor amenities including the pool, basketball court 
and spacious picnic area. We are also located close to shopping, dining and 
entertainment near downtown Provo.

resources.name: BioLife Plasma
resources.description: Requires permanent local address, $80? for the first donation
resources.servicesText: Plasma donation center

resources.name: People Ready
resources.description: PeopleReady supports a wide range of industries, including construction, manufacturing and logistics, retail and hospitality. Pays daily.
resources.servicesText: Gig work through JobStack app.

resources.name: Talecris Plasma
resources.description: Requires proof of current address (or border crossing card)
resources.servicesText: Plasma donation center

resources.name: Bacon Work
resources.description: Temporary work--warehouse, events, catering, general labor
resources.servicesText: an iPhone or Android app (search for bacon work) — Warehouse, events, catering, general labor

resources.name: Bingham Family Clinic
resources.description: Free Healthcare for the uninsured, household income less that 300% of poverty level, Utah County residents
resources.servicesText:
Acute Care
Primary Care
Specialty Care
Educational Classes

resources.name: Driver License Division (ID for homeless persons)
resources.address: 1503 S 40 E, suite 250, Provo or 759 N 1370 W, Orem or 2277 W 700 S, suite 1, Springville
resources.description: Driver License Offices for homeless ID
resources.servicesText:
homeless ID--go to Community Action Services or Food & Care Coalition 
to get a verification of homelessness (waives fee), then take the verification
and apply in person.
